tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season rates generally continue, offering good value.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Pleasant autumn feel. Can be quieter, especially mid-week. More focus shifts towards indoor activities if weather is poor.

events_holidays.name: DocLisboa Continues/Concludes
events_holidays.description: The international documentary film festival continues its screenings and events.
events_holidays.notes: Check festival schedule for specific dates and venues.

events_holidays.name: Lisbon Marathon (Maratona de Lisboa)
events_holidays.description: Major running event attracting international participation, often featuring a scenic course along the riverfront.
events_holidays.notes: Significant road closures on race day. Energetic atmosphere for spectators.

events_holidays.name: Halloween Celebrations
events_holidays.description: While not a traditional Portuguese holiday, Halloween is celebrated with parties in bars/clubs and themed events, especially popular with younger crowds and expats.
events_holidays.notes: Not a public holiday. Look for events advertised at bars, particularly in Bairro Alto or Cais do Sodré.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the exceptional collection of art spanning millennia and continents, plus the Modern Collection. Perfect indoor activity.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Allow ample time (2-3 hours+). Check opening days (closed Tuesdays). The surrounding gardens are beautiful in autumn colors.

unique_experiences.description: Discover the shops, restaurants, and creative spaces in this vibrant converted industrial complex.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good place to spend an afternoon, especially if dodging showers. Many indoor spaces. Sunday market is popular.

unique_experiences.description: Experience the soulful sounds of traditional Portuguese Fado music in an intimate club or restaurant.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book ahead for popular venues. Choose between dinner shows or drinks-only venues. Cozy indoor experience for cooler evenings.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a coastal walk and explore the charming town of Cascais, even if beach weather is less certain.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take the train from Cais do Sodré. Good for walking the 'paredão' (seafront promenade). Fewer crowds than summer.

reasons_to_visit.details: September offers a sweet spot with warm, sunny days (avg. high 26°C) but less intense heat than July/August. Evenings are pleasant, perfect for outdoor dining and exploring.
While still busy, the peak summer crowds start to dissipate, especially later in the month, making visits to popular sites like Belém and São Jorge Castle more manageable.
The Atlantic waters are at their warmest in September, making it the best month for comfortable swimming at nearby beaches like Cascais or Costa da Caparica.
Accommodation and flight prices may start to decrease slightly compared to July and August, particularly towards the end of the month, offering better value.
Lisbon often hosts cultural events like MOTELx (Lisbon International Horror Film Festival) and outdoor concerts continue while the weather remains good.
The pleasant weather and slightly fewer crowds make September ideal for day trips to Sintra, Cascais, or other nearby towns.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: September remains a popular month for tourism. Don't expect empty attractions; queues and crowds are still common, especially in the first half of the month.
While potentially slightly lower than peak summer, prices for accommodation remain relatively high, especially in central locations.
Early September can still experience lingering summer heat, with days potentially exceeding 30°C (86°F).
Some specific summer-long festivals or outdoor event series might conclude early in September.

weather.precipitation: Low chance of rain, typically only 2-4 rainy days in the month. Days are predominantly sunny and warm.
weather.general_tips: Pack light summer clothing, swimwear, sunglasses, hat, and sunscreen. A light layer (cardigan or light jacket) is useful for evenings.

tourism_level.crowds: High. Still feels like peak season, especially in the first week as summer holidays conclude across Europe.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices generally persist from summer.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant and summery. Outdoor dining, rooftop bars, and beaches are very active.

events_holidays.name: MOTELx - Lisbon International Horror Film Festival
events_holidays.description: Portugal's premier horror film festival screens international and national features and shorts at Cinema São Jorge.
events_holidays.notes: Tickets required. Attracts genre film fans.

events_holidays.name: Caixa Alfama Fado Festival
events_holidays.description: Major Fado festival taking place across various stages and venues within the historic Alfama district.
events_holidays.notes: Tickets required (often a wristband for multiple venues). Features big names and rising stars of Fado. Atmospheric event.

events_holidays.name: OUT JAZZ Festival
events_holidays.description: Free jazz concerts continue in a designated city garden each weekend afternoon/evening.
events_holidays.notes: Check schedule for September's location. Great for a relaxed afternoon.

unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of the warmest sea temperatures of the year for a swim at the beaches near Cascais.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Train from Cais do Sodré. Water is still refreshingly cool (~19-20°C) but most comfortable in September. Beaches still busy.

unique_experiences.where: Various (e.g., Park Bar, TOPO Martim Moniz, Memmo Alfama Terrace)
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy drinks and stunning views as the sun sets over the city on a warm September evening.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Still popular, arrive reasonably early for good spots. Enjoy the lingering warmth.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic streets, perhaps catching some early Fado festival atmosphere if timing aligns.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Still warm for walking, comfortable shoes essential. Enjoy viewpoints like Portas do Sol.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the Jerónimos Monastery, Belém Tower, etc. Queues may be slightly shorter than July/August but still expect lines.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Go early. Consider Lisboa Card. Weather generally excellent for this area.

weather.precipitation: Slightly increased chance of occasional showers towards the end of the month, but still predominantly dry and sunny.
weather.general_tips: Continue with summer attire but ensure you have a light jacket or sweater for evenings, which become noticeably cooler.

tourism_level.crowds: High, but noticeably decreasing compared to early September and peak summer. More comfortable for sightseeing.
tourism_level.pricing: May start to see slightly lower shoulder season rates for accommodation, especially towards the very end of the month.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Still summery and pleasant, but calmer than the absolute peak season. Ideal balance for many visitors.

events_holidays.name: Caixa Alfama Fado Festival (continues/concludes)
events_holidays.description: Lisbon's main Fado festival continues to fill the Alfama district with music.
events_holidays.notes: Check schedule. Booking tickets/wristbands in advance recommended.

events_holidays.name: Santa Casa Alfama (alternative name/iteration for Alfama Fado Fest)
events_holidays.description: Sometimes the Alfama Fado festival branding changes slightly year to year but concept remains similar.
events_holidays.notes: Confirm exact name and dates for the specific year.

events_holidays.name: OUT JAZZ Festival Continues
events_holidays.description: Free weekend jazz concerts continue in a designated city garden.
events_holidays.notes: Check schedule for September's location.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the magical palaces and estates with more manageable crowds and pleasant walking temperatures.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Go early, book tickets online. Weather ideal for exploring the extensive gardens (e.g., Pena Park, Regaleira).

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a pleasant walk or bike ride along the river with comfortable temperatures and beautiful light.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Flat, easy walk. Rent bikes near Cais do Sodré. Stop at riverside cafes.

unique_experiences.description: Browse the unique shops, restaurants, and art installations in this trendy industrial space. Pleasant outdoor areas.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good for an afternoon visit. Sunday market is popular. Lively atmosphere in the evenings.

unique_experiences.where: Restaurants with viewpoints (e.g., Chapitô à Mesa, Pharmacia)
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy dinner at a restaurant offering great views over the city as the evenings are still warm enough for terrace dining.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book terraces in advance. Check sunset times. Bring a light layer for later.
